channel.title: 3mpwr App - Curated Disability News
channel.description: Daily curated news on disability rights, accessibility, and benefits across Canada

item.title: Could Canada join Eurovision Song Contest? Experts say audience needed
item.description: The federal budget included a line that said the government was working with CBC/Radio Canada to explore the possibility of Canada entering the Eurovision Song Contest.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Federal budget commits $1B to Arctic Infrastructure Fund
item.description: The budget proposes $1 billion over four years for Transport Canada to invest in major transportation projects in the North, including airports, seaports, all-season roads and highways, for both civilian and military use. CBC News speaks with former army commander Andrew Leslie for more.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Old caves yield new secrets from Canadians who went over the top at Vimy Ridge
item.description: A hidden archive of what for many were last thoughts and tributes to Canada is emerging from the soft chalk tunnels beneath the Vimy Ridge battlefield more than a century after they were created.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Could a rise in Indigenous-led developments move the needle on Canada's housing shortage?
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Canada could face ‘worst kind’ of flu season as experts warn evolving strain may be mismatch for vaccine
item.description: With flu cases now rising in Canada, medical experts are bracing for a difficult influenza season linked to the global spread of an evolving H3N2 strain that could be a mismatch for this year’s vaccine.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: N.S. Supreme Court chief justice defends staff poppy ban in some courtrooms
item.description: Chief justice of the Supreme Court of Nova Scotia notes banning court staff from wearing of poppies is 'very sensitive,' but said there can be 'no signs of favouritism' in court.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Chief judges back court poppy ban after backlash
item.description: The heads of Nova Scotia's supreme and provincial courts are expressing their support for judges who ban court staff from pinning poppies to their robes during proceedings after some Canadian politicians called the practice wrong.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: What’s in the federal budget for you? Your questions answered
item.description: Many Canadians wrote to us asking what they should be looking for in the new federal budget. CBC News’ Catherine Cullen and J.P. Tasker are here to help break down what is – and isn’t – in the budget.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Manitoba Government Honours Indigenous Veterans and Supports First-Annual Powwow
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: The journey toward an expanded Port of Churchill has only just begun
item.description: Compared to  other major projects  granted "national importance" status by Mark Carney’s Liberal government, the proposed expansion of the Port of Churchill is still a very fuzzy idea.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: After fuel spill in B.C. lake, early tests show no contamination above drinking water guidelines
item.description: B.C. officials say that preliminary tests show no contamination above drinking water guidelines after 80,000 litres of fuel was spilled into Kamloops Lake following a train derailment.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Southern Ontario, parts of Quebec see 1st snowfall of the season
item.description: Snow is falling on parts of southern Ontario and southern and central Quebec on Sunday with the potential for some regions to see up to 20 centimetres of snow.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Accessibility is coming to playgrounds in Regina
item.description: Sarah Turnbull isn't just a city councillor, but also a mother, and she's looking to make a change when it comes to accessible parks in Regina.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Advocates concerned temporary immigration cuts don't address systemic issues
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Margaret Atwood is finally calling people out in her new memoir
item.description: Does Margaret Atwood hold a grudge? 'I don't have a choice. I'm a Scorpio,' the celebrated Canadian novelist tells The Current in an interview about her new memoir Book of Lives.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: How one North Vancouver school is redefining education for neurodiverse learners in B.C.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Nield thrilled to help gambling Riders beat Lions
item.description: Touchdown Tommy Nield is going to the Grey Cup again -- and this time he's taking the Saskatchewan Roughriders with him.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Roughriders off to Grey Cup after beating Lions
item.description: Tommy Nield's three-yard touchdown reception with 11 seconds left in the fourth quarter lifted the Saskatchewan Roughriders to a 24-21 victory over the B.C. Lions in the West Division final Saturday, sending the Riders to the Grey Cup.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Riders score late TD to down Lions, punch ticket to Grey Cup
item.description: The Saskatchewan defence forced back-to-back two-and-out possessions to give their offence an opportunity to win the game.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator
